data.title: Nicely upgraded for an old hotel
data.text: The union league club is a grand hotel - the rooms had grown tired and old the last time I visited.  This time the upgrades were apparent.  The bathroom was modern and clean.  The bed and room were nicely updated.  The location is good for loop and west loop locations.  Parking is adjacent and convenient.  The dining and conference rooms remain above average.

data.title: Excellent Service
data.text:
I stayed at Union League for 4 days with meetings in the club every day. My recollection from years ago was that the guest rooms were dated, but my room on this trip was nice and fresh. The bed was very comfortable and the linens were high quality. Everything in the bath had been updated.

What most impressed me was the level of service in the meeting room area. We were in 4 different meeting rooms on the 8th floor. They have many different sizes and configurations so you should be able to find one that fits your needs. 

The service in the meeting rooms was exceptional. They brought breakfast and lunch into our meetings every day. The servers were quiet as mice as they set up and later took away the food. If a guest needed something extra they were accommodating. When I ran into a problem the banquet went right into problem solving mode to address.

I would highly recommend this place as a meeting venue.

data.title: Best bed I've slept on
data.text: We stayed for 3 nights on a wonderful weekend in Chicago. We didn't eat at the club however had drinks each night after being out for dinner. The room was excellent and the bed was the most comfortable I've slept in. The staff are extremely welcoming and helpful. I would highly recommend.

data.title: Outstanding old world elegance
data.text:
The club is outstanding. 
We stayed one night at the club hotel for my husbands conference.
The room was clean, nicely decorated and had all the amenities necessary.
The only thing I had to complaint about is not having free water bottles in the room.
They had no mini bar or a refrigerator. 
The restaurant at the front 4th floor was nice but nothing special.
The fitness room was fantastic.
Overall a great club and hotel.

data.title: Historic in the heart of the financial district
data.text: Stayed on business as my meetings were a couple blocks over on the same street. Very historic, elegant, not modern but very comfortable. I ended up with a handicap accessible room, which was fantastic as it was large. The bathroom was huge. Very clean top to bottom. Bed was comfortable. Free wifi, HBO on the tv. Many amenities in the hotel/club including a fitness facility, bar, restaurants (plural)...even a library. they even have a computer and printer available to print off your boarding passes when you check out. Employees were exceptionally friendly. We watched a baseball game and had dinner in the Rendevous Lounge. Place was nice, atmosphere outstanding, food was great. Highly recommend staying here.

data.title: outstanding club, made us at home
data.text: we are reciprocal members and they treated us like family.  The beds were fantastic and comfy.  rooms are clean and service was super!  we enjoyed cocktails and wine on the fourth floor in the pub by the fireplace.  loved it.

data.title: Outstanding Club!
data.text: As a member of a reciprocal club I chose to stay at the Union League Club in Chicago overnight while in the city on business.  I was very impressed with the accommodations and the location.  This club is in the heart of downtown Chicago.  Its location provides easy access to public transportation and is within walking distance of great food and entertainment.  The room and amenities were great - exceeding my expectations and experiences at many chain hotels.  Access to the other amenities of the club (e.g. Fitness Center, Restaurants) is an added bonus.  I'll stay here again without a second thought.

data.title: Great hotel in the heart of Chicago
data.text: This beautiful hotel is right down town.  Close enough to walk to many places, as well as being about 1/2 block from the subway.  The rooms were very nice.  Comfy beds and nice decor.  The bathroom was on the small side but had upgraded walk-in tiled shower and granite counters.  No safe in the room, though.  Great food in the restaurant and also what was catered for our event.  What was fantastic was the artwork.  Beautiful pictures hanging everywhere included a Monet.

data.title: overnight at the union league club of chicago
data.text: First I should say that i am a member of the club so i might be a little biased. But if you want to be treated like king or queen this is the place for you whether business or pleasure. The club has many options within the facility. Full gym facilities, pool, whirlpools both hot and cold, steam rooms, plus full restaurants and a beautiful bar. Another factor is the location which is in the heart of the loop. I have stayed here on many occasions and enjoy it every time. Naturally the rooms are very comfortable, quiet and immaculate.

data.title: Best club in town!
data.text: We have been members for over 40 years. The dining options are numerous. The venue is incredible for special events, we had our daughter's wedding there. The artwork is incredible, a remarkable collection. The old world architecture is absolutely beautiful.  The guest rooms are updated , lovely and come in many sizes. A wonderful oasis for business or pleasure in Chicago.

data.title: Wonderful Spot
data.text:
We held meetings here over a weekend and the Club could not have taken better care of us. Dinner ran over the number requested by a bunch both nights and the staff just accommodated us without a hitch or hiccup. Breakfast was fabulous and I never even got to the omelette station. 
Then, on the spur of the moment, we decided to look at the facilities to have our large meeting here in several years. A member of the sales staff showed up in ten minutes providing us with a first class full tour. We all really like this place. And the food at dinner was superb.

data.title: Top notch
data.text: It had been several years but now I remember how much I enjoy the ULC.   Room was first class and all meals and the bar were equally great.  Had really good clam chowder for lunch, pasta with lobster for dinner and the breakfast buffet was excellent. And the staff was really first class.   Wouldn't come to Chicago and not stay here

data.title: Old School Elegance
data.text:
If you need a fine Loop hotel that has exceptional service - look no further! The location is ideal for restaurants and theaters.

Inspired: the artwork 

Atmosphere: elegant historic hotel

Service: attentive and first class

Food and drink: very good - remember the dress code

Parking: used Via and Uber - and Spothero in lot behind hotel

Discovered: from friends 

Return: would love to!

data.title: Very nice, centrally located
data.text: Our family of three stayed in this hotel in June. The hotel is centrally located and walking distance from a vast assortment of landmarks and entertainment. The room was nice and comfortable. The bathroom was a little small for counter space. There is a dress code in the hotel restaurants, but it wasn't a big deal. We knew about it ahead of time and planned accordingly.

data.title: Hidden gem
data.text: On the weekends, when the lawyers and business people go home, the Loop and the ULCC take on a quieter, slower, pleasant pace.  Great pool, brunch, restaurant; quiet, well air conditioned rooms.  Free wifi.  Red line El station close by. Happy here.

data.title: Amazing place to stay!
data.text:
I'm not the person who would usually stay at a place like The Union League Club, but I was honored to spend a weekend there with a girlfriend that was a member of a similar club in Saint Louis. I'm assuming you need a membership or sponsor to stay here, or have some type of reciprocal thing, like we did. 

The room was absolutely fabulous. I was surprised that the bed was as comfortable as it was! I always assume hotel beds will hurt my back, but I slept like a baby here. The bathroom was kind of tiny, but I'm assuming it's because of how old the building is. 

The building itself is gorgeous and filled with history. The service is also amazing, and you can't find a better location. 

We had dinner at the restaurant in the building on a Saturday night. Although it was surprisingly empty, the food was impeccable. We even took glasses of champagne back to our room. 

Overall, this was a fabulous experience, and I'd love to go back.

data.title: Best City Club in Midwest
data.text: I recently had occasion to travel to the East Coast and have stayed at several highly regarded private city clubs (e.g.  NYAC, Jonathan Club and Union League in Philly). I returned to my home club in Chicago,   The Union League Club and was reminded about how good we have it - warm and inviting public rooms, great attentive service and a wide variety of dining amenities (from poolside casual to dressy fine dining).  My wife and I had to stay in the hotel rooms at the ULC due to some construction work at home and we were again saw how truly luxe the experience was. Strongly recommend it for an out of town business-person.

data.title: Still my favorite place to stay in Chicago
data.text: Not so central anymore as the activity has moved to near north, but with cabs, Uber, and Lyft it just doesn't matter.  Excellent exercise facilities.  A fabulous and beautiful library so you do not have to work in your room.  The only problem is that it is too popular and often booked full.

data.title: You need a membership or a sponsor
data.text: Great staff that tends to your every need.  Property is unassuming and in a great part of downtown Chicago near the Federal Reserve Building.  Proper attire must be worn when in public areas of the complex.  Terrific restaurant.  We had complimentary lobster with our steak entrees.  Rooms can be small and bathrooms even smaller.  You may want to request a suite.  Terry cloth robes available in your room.  Breakfast, lunch and dinner are all available in at least two restaurants on premises.  I know they also host events including authors and guest speakers.

data.title: Breakfast
data.text: I came to Chicago for a conference. In my free day, I was not allowed to have my breakfast, because I was wearing jeans! I explained I was not a club member, but a guest. "Hotel policy", they told me. Worse experience ever!
